Why Your Best Work Stays Hidden

I tinkered with a weekend coding project. Four hours spent, 90% functional. Imperfect, but it worked.

This made me realize: perfectionism is procrastination’s elegant disguise. It whispers “not ready” while progress slips away.

Perfectionism can lead to procrastination.
The pursuit of perfection? A perfect path to paralysis.

I’ve been there. Have you? Stuck in the quicksand of “what if”.

The antidote? Start. Now.

Your unwritten book is infinitely worse than your messy first draft.

Your unstarted business costs more than your imperfect launch.

Your delayed decision is a decision itself — usually the wrong one.

My Week’s Mantra: Progress over perfection. Daily. Relentlessly.

🏆 Ask yourself: “What small win can I achieve today?” Compound these wins.
✅ Remember: Doing something imperfectly beats doing nothing flawlessly. Always.
